metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26951 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A parsing and event loading mismatch in Firefox's SVG code could haveallowed load events to fire, even after sanitization. An attacker alreadycapable of exploiting an XSS vulnerability in privileged internal pagescould have used this attack to bypass our built-in sanitizer. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 83, Firefox ESR < 78.5, and Thunderbird <78.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26951` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
firefox-geckodriver - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
firefox-mozsymbols - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu0.16.04.3').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
